data.text: extremely and usually suddenly excited, upset, or angry: wild
examples: He went ballistic when he saw the dent in his car.
But the Bell Labs switch uses such a low current that the few ballistic electrons are a distance of a micrometer or more apart …
… engineered specifically to be worn under ballistic vests and shirts.

data.text: of or relating to the science of the motion of projectiles in flight
examples: He went ballistic when he saw the dent in his car.
But the Bell Labs switch uses such a low current that the few ballistic electrons are a distance of a micrometer or more apart …
… engineered specifically to be worn under ballistic vests and shirts.

data.text: being or characterized by repeated bouncing
examples: He went ballistic when he saw the dent in his car.
But the Bell Labs switch uses such a low current that the few ballistic electrons are a distance of a micrometer or more apart …
… engineered specifically to be worn under ballistic vests and shirts.

data.text: a usually rocket-powered missile that is launched in a high arc under guidance for its ascent but that is unpowered and unguided once it begins its descent
